alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:55PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Callahan and northeastern Coleman Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 555 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Coleman, or near Oplin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rowden, Burkett, Oplin, Us-283 Near The Coleman- Callahan County Line, Echo and Lake Coleman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
